thread.title: China set for shock raid of Roos boss Ange
thread.title_full: China set for shock raid of Roos boss Ange

title: China set for shock raid of Roos boss Ange
text:
Chinese Super League clubs linked with a shock move for Ange Postecoglou: reports February 26, 2017 8:42pm by Staff writers Source: FOX SPORTS SHOCKWAVES will be sent through Australian football should a Chinese Super League bid for Socceroos boss Ange Postecoglou pay off. 
Fresh off the announcement of the Socceroos’ blockbuster friendly against Brazil in June at the MCG, reports have emerged that at least one wealthy Chinese club will attempt to pry Postecoglou away from the national team job. 
According to Fairfax Media, Postecoglou is at the top of a shopping list for CSL clubs with just 18 months remaining on his five-year deal with Football Federation Australia. 
That contract will see him through to the end of the 2018 World Cup in Russia, with Australia facing crucial qualifiers in 2017 before playing in the Confederations Cup at the end of the season. Socceroos coach Ange Postecoglou celebrates winning the Asian Cup Final. Picture Gregg Porteous Source: News Corp Australia 
Sources suggest Postecoglou has been targeted by at least one unnamed club in recent weeks, having also been linked with the Greece national team job in the past. 
Postecoglou’s impressive record with the Socceroos has seen his reputation peak, winning the 2015 Asian Cup despite Australia lacking players of star quality. 
Since taking over from Holger Osieck prior to the 2014 World Cup, Postecoglou has created a strong belief within a fresh squad while also promoting an exciting, attacking brand of football. 
That brand of football saw him have unmatched success in the A-League with Brisbane Roar, who won two Grand Finals under Postecoglou’s tutelage, including going 36 games undefeated.
